summary: "The Great Wave off Kanagawa" is a famous Japanese artwork by Hokusai, made in 1831. It shows three boats struggling against a huge, swirling wave, with Mount Fuji in the background. This print is very special because it uses a new color, Prussian blue, and combines Japanese and European art styles. It became super popular in Japan and later in Europe, inspiring many artists like Van Gogh and Monet. Today, it's considered one of the most famous Japanese artworks ever, and many museums around the world have copies.
title: The Great Wave off Kanagawa
